text: bit emotional about it a long time when
Barack Obama was elected to 44th
President of the United States sergeant
Dorothea Harris was overcome with
emotion but most of the enlisted
soldiers at Forward Operating Base
Falcon in Iraq watched the election
results with quiet Cheers or an
occasional grunt to disgust
Obama has opposed the war here and wants
US troops out quickly that position was
a strong magnet for some booters drawing
votes away from John McCain ok 90 at one
point he said that we will stay in Iraq
as long as there's violence here and the
violence here has been ongoing for so
many years I don't really think that
violence here will ever stop it won't
ever be curbed really for me I'm serving
my first combat to I know some of my
friends on their second even third and
fourth that's just not a comfortable
segment to be said you know we're we're
going to stay in Iraq and so we're not
needed the Iraq war was also cited by
soldiers who supported senator john
mccain the GOP candidate who supported
the war and had pledged to stay much
longer I John McCain because of his
experience you know some of us have
spent three almost three years here in
the past you know four or five six years
that's a lot of time to be away from
home and family so I think it had a lot
to do with it it'd be something hard to
swallow because of all the work we have
done over here and I mean I I guess said
it'd be hard to swallow i don't think i
could just up and leave and forget
everything that's happened with in
talking to the enlisted soldiers here
there was a sense of hope around some of
obama supporters like obama face is it's
time for a change we looking for a
change in america and uh i myself uh I'm
looking for change also just my third
time to pawn you know I don't want to
come back over here anymore I mean I
love my kind of shot served my country
prolly but to me three times is enough
and I think the world should be it
should be done with but the hope seemed
tinged with skepticism
election promises will not automatically
change military policies that have led
to deployments in Iraq and Afghanistan
the issues that most directly impact
these soldiers lives where they serve
how long they live away from home or in
harm's way the final answer to all of
these questions remains undecided
you
